no_shortcuts.description: No fallbacks, no artificially speeding up the process, no shortcuts unless explicitly requested

async_long_tasks.description: If running something is taking too long, start it in the background and return the prompt to the user, set a way to monitor the execution

verified_sources.description: Always use real information that is from a reliable source that is on the article/ folder

communication_style.description: Always use simple language, as a computer Science student, never use emojis, use kebab case when needed for variables, classes and functions, when needed

comment_location.description: Only make comments on the source code on the header, never inside the code functions

no_llm_markers.description: Never mention inside the code fixes or custom requests or anything that could be attributed to automatic code generation by an LLM

no_authors.description: Never mention authors I will do it manually

directory_usage.description: use the .claudecode/memory/ for your memory; use the article/ folder for articles; use the data/ folder for datasets; use the temp/ folder for smaller tests; use temp/tests/ for long tests

expert_mode.description: do your best to act as a PhD in every subject being worked on but if in doubt Always ask, stop the creation process and ask
